events.name: Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
events.description:
Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
31 Oct- 1 November, Sat to Sun, 10am to 7pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Sense and Sensuality celebrates new creative approaches that bring artists and designers together with engineers, scientists, and scholars from other fields. This showcase examines how technology is being used to interact with our body, cultures and surroundings, and engage our senses and expand our sensibility. Artists participating in this exhibition comprise faculty, students and alumni from NTU School of Art, Design and Media (ADM). The showcase is divided into five areas including craft, form, function, expression, and dimension in relation to technology.
Official fringe event of Digital Fashion Week Singapore 2015
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: A look at 3D Scanning Faces To Create Personalized Eyewear
events.description: Hi all, Thanks to IDA@labs @National Design Centre, we have a venue for this Saturday's 3D face scanning meetup. For those who have joined us for our earlier meetups - A Big Thank you!  We found your enthusiasm and feedback very inspiring and we're now excited to conduct a few more sessions where we will scan your face to custom fit our future Eye Wear products to you.  Looking forward to a wonderful 3D scanning experience.  From your friends and humble collaborators, Victor & Gibson & The Team.

events.name: Hackerspace Talk: Sentiment Analysis at Bloomberg
events.description:
Speaker Profile
Gary Kazantsev runs the R&D Machine Learning team at Bloomberg. He leads projects at the intersection of computational linguistics and machine learning such as sentiment analysis, market impact indicators, text classification, social media analytics, question answering, recommendation systems and predictive modeling of financial markets. He holds degrees in physics, mathematics and computer science.

Disclaimer: this talk is technical, and it is expected that all attendees have some prior, introductory knowledge to Machine Learning.
events.location: NUS Hackerspace

events.name: talk.js PayPal Edition
events.description: Douglas Crockford is visiting Singapore. We have come out with this special event with PayPal and invited Douglas to give a talk to the SingaporeJS community! Upgrading the Web  The web was originally imagined to be a simple distributed document retrieval system. It is now being used for applications that go far beyond the system's original capabilities and intentions. We have found ways to make it work, but they are difficult and far too fragile. Many times companies have offered to replace the web with superior proprietary systems, but we rejected them. We have been adding features to the web, but this does little to correct the deep underlying deficiencies, increasing instead of reducing its complexity. This talk suggests a way forward, taking inspiration from our successful transition from NTSC to HDTV. There is a way forward to a web that is safer, easier, and as good as we desire. Douglas Crockford is best known for his ongoing involvement in the development of the JavaScript language, for having popularized JSON, and for developing various JavaScript tools such as JSLint and JSMin. He is currently a senior JavaScript architect at PayPal, and is also a writer and speaker on JavaScript, JSON, and related web technologies. Location: PayPal SingaporeSuntec Tower 55 Temasek Boulevard #09-01Singapore Venue, free drinks and pizza sponsored by PayPal. Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Dream Brewery Hackathon
events.description: The love for beer and its craft has been around for ages but nothing has changed much since. Here’s a crazy idea for you. What would happen if we apply technology to this classic drink? Come hack 3 challenges with ABInBev at the Dream Brewery Hackathon on November 7th & 8th and stand a chance to win cash prizes, cool toys & even mentorship support to revolutionise the F&B space!  Use “Free4iOSDev” @ http://Bitly.com/dreambreweryhackathon­ to get FREE tickets to the hack!  PRIZES • The first place team will receive S$2,000 and Apple iWatches  Second Place Team: S$1,000 + Cherokey 4wd Robot Kits • Third Place Team: S$500 + Insectbot Kits • Immediate Qualification: The top 3 winning teams directly qualify for the Budweiser Dream Brewery Pitch Day on February 18, 2016 (pitch your tech and your team could win: S$25,000 funding, incubation & partnership opportunities)  JUDGES  • APAC CIO, ABInBev • APAC Innovation Manager, ABInBev • Tyson Hackwood, Head of Asia, Braintree • Bradley Priest, CTO/Cofounder, TradeGecko • Michael Lints, Venture Partner, Golden Gate Ventures • As well as other top CTOs and VCs
events.location: The Hub Singapore, 128 Prinsep Street, #01-01

events.name: Learn Chef Configuration Management Part 1
events.description: ** Had to bump this due to logistics and availability **The future of management and configuration of the Microsoft platform is Desired State Configuration. Chef is a configuration management product that is fully leveraging the DSC platform is important to the DevOps movement. There is some great content at learnchef.io which I have wanted to go through for a while but have yet to schedule in. So I am scheduling the time to do it.If you would like to Learn Chef too, join me for this Meetup. I cannot provide any expertise on Chef whatsoever, but I can provide a room with a big screen, food, uninterrupted time to watch the content and go through the labs as well as others to discuss with and expertise on DSC.If this sounds like something you'd like to do please come along, let's learn Chef and progress our journey to DevOps.

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Strangeweather Movement Group with Andy Yang: Spooky Action (at a Distance) II
Thursday 19 November
Performance starts at 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Lobby
FREE


For ArtScience Late, Strangeweather Movement Group revisits a 2013 performance work, Spooky Action (at a Distance), in collaboration with visual artist and musician Andy Yang. In Spooky, Strangeweather considers the theory of quantum entanglement, puts it on the backburner, and creates an off-kilter dance performance of impolite improvisation scores and congruent choreography. Yang intercepts the performance with a resounding set installation and what happens next is anyone’s guess. This rendition of Spooky is performed by Bernice Lee, Faye Lim and Andy Yang. Excerpts of the original performance were featured in filmmaker Karol Jalochowski’s documentary, Reality Lost, which was commissioned by NUS Centre for Quantum
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Hackware v1.3
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (20min) Astro-photography and hardware (Celestial Portraits)- Remus CJ

2. (20min) TinyMOS (World's first consumer astronomy camera) - Grey Chen Junyang

3. (20min) TBC

4. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

5. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:

♥ Venue provided by Science Center Singapore ♥ http://www.science.edu.sg/Pages/SCBHome.aspx
events.location: Digital Planetarium Singapore

events.name: Security In The World Of CI-CD
events.description: Continuous Delivery (CD) is a set of practices and principles in software engineering aimed at, building, testing, and releasing software, faster and more frequently. These principles help reduce the cost, time and risk of delivering changes, and ultimately value, to customers by allowing for more incremental changes to applications in production. Continuous integration (CI) is the practice, in software engineering, of merging all developer working copies to a shared mainline several times a day. In the same vein, the practice of continuous delivery further extends CI by making sure the software checked in on the mainline is always in a state that can be deployed to users and makes the actual deployment process very rapid. So, in this rapid and fast world of CI-CD, focusing on highly scalable & highly portable software landscape, which offers high usage oriented web apps, the security landscape has really reached to cutting edge point. This talk, will focus on how to posturize security with this fast pace world, covering most of all security verticals. Speaker:Aniket Kulkarni, carries decade+ of software security experience flowing from QA, Development & Architecture.Currently he works as Software Security Architect (Bigdata\Cloud\Mobile\Web), in Autodesk Singapore R&D, one of world class design software developing companies across the globe. For more information about Aniket, kindly get connected with him on linkedin: https://sg.linkedin.com/pub/aniket-kulkarni/10/653/202 , and he will be happy to interact with you for various security related discussions.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616

events.name: Building Castles in the Air - Cybersecurity and the Cloud
events.description:
In collaboration with HGP Asia, we bring you a very special event on Cyber Security and Cloud Computing, for a series of presentations from industry professionals on cyber security, information risk management, and cloud implementation strategies, now open for our meetup members! 


The purpose? Create better awareness of how you can protect valuable corporate data assets that are threatened by cyber attacks improve understanding of the benefits and risks of today's information landscape where cloud solutions become an everyday part of our business A practical understanding of key considerations and strategies for how to adopt Cloud solutions to your organisation 


Speakers: Ming Chua, Director, HGP Asia Thomas Halfmann, Partner, HGP Pierre Noël, Chief Security Officer Asia, Microsoft Corporation Monika Josi, Partner & Senior Consultant, HGP Management Consulting Jon Reich, Senior Consultant, HGP Asia 


Necessary refreshments provided, and we can head off for an informal drink and get-together after the end of the event around 5pm. How's that? :-) Cheers, Ee Bin Organizer Health 2.0 Singapore
events.location: Hotel Meritus Mandarin Orchard, 333 Orchard Road, Singapore 238867

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description:
Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series.

Innovati50n reconstructed @ ArtScience museum
An Interlude of Science meets Art by A*STAR & NAFA
(Workshops and ‘pop up’ talks throughout the day)
Saturday and Sunday, 5 & 6 December
10am - 7pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE


The Agency of Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) & the Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) have created 17 science-inspired exhibits using
an array of artistic techniques such as fine art, digital art, photography, sculpture and others. Meet the scientists and artists behind this creative showcase of Singapore’s scientific innovations and get hands-on with our unique Science-Art workshops and demos.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

Perfect for anyone who has a story or an idea that could be told interactively but doesn't know where or how to get started. Or, for anyone who has a new code or library to try out but doesn't have a story angle yet. More information to come - we'll send out announcements soon.

events.name: EML30 Music Festival
events.description:
In celebration of NUS Electronic Music Lab's 30th anniversary, we are holding the EML30 Music Festival on the 12th December at Lepark Singapore from 12pm to 6pm.

EML30 Music Festival will play host to 2, hour-long music forums to discuss the eco-system of electronic music in Singapore beyond 2015, amongst varsity institutional groups and industry leaders respectively.

In addition, there will be 4 hours of original electronic music by our artists, such as Ocean's Children, Kids With Laptops, Mitch Advent, nanowander, Brannlum and many more throughout the afternoon, spanning a multitude of genres accompanied by stunning visuals.

Food and drinks can be purchased at Lepark, so be sure to enjoy the delicious food and tasteful craft beers while you catch the show.
events.location: Lepark
